Posts.Content: I had floconazole grrr gave me terrible tummy pain n irritable bowls so stopped taking em,  I've also had oral thrush with both my last tax it's so horrible n went down onto my throat he gave me different mouthwash n lasted just over a wk.  all I ate was soup n pasta for a wk, n cold drinks as hot ones just burnt my throat, it's a nasty part if not worst part of the cycle but will pass.  Sarah x
Posts.Title: Docetaxal and dry throat/mouth

Posts.Content: I don't think so not from injections anyway,  I'm sure the side effects I've had are from the tax, I've been on antibiotics 4 oral thrush which gave me terrible belly pain and irritable bowls,  aching joints and tender nails. ive got op to face nxt which I've got app tomorrow with surgeon about then rads so 2 more hurdles  hey Dysiewig when's ya last 1  hugs
Posts.Title: 4th FEC done

Posts.Content: Will u b doing injections yourself?  I did, was scared at 1st but has district nurses help me with 1st 1 then I was ok doing on my own.  They really do make a different, I've had more energy this time round.  Yayy to 2 more hope it flies by, I've got my last 1 nxt wk sooo can't wait. Sarah x
Posts.Title: 4th FEC done

Posts.Content: Defo just doubly checking, after all, all this prep is to guide the surgeon to the right place to ensure minimal scaring.   I was a pin cusion on the morning of my surgery but can look bac n laugh now with a slight cringe ha.  Had to b there for 9.30 to have nuclear medicine so they could (with a marker pen) mark were my nodes were with a little note written on my shoulder for the surgeon wasnt given enough anisthetic so of course I screamed ha, Then went over the road to a different hospital for an ultra sound were she marked on 1 of my boobs were the remaining tumour was along with another note for the surgeon ha, unfortunately the US couldn't find the tumour in my other boob so had to walk accross corridor wrapped in a gown for a mammagram n have wire put in,  again wasn't given enough anisthetic so of course I screamed. Then seconds l8r anither mammagram to check the wire was in the correct place by now I wanted to punch the nxt nurse who dare come near me with another needle. By lunchtime my boobs n ribs were covered in notes n arrows all to guide the surgeon. good luck it will all b over b4 u know it.  Wishing u a speedy recovery  love Sarah x
Posts.Title: mammogram before op

Posts.Content: It all came good in the end, my surgeon came to see me just b4 my op (fantastic lady) to have a look at all the prep work.  It was quite a comical moment, I took my top half off stood there and said 'you won't loose this bit of paper will you.  We bot couldn't stop laughing at all the notes written on me. ive seen the word cording few times now, which I'm not familiar with, Judith/anyone can u explain what this is please, I'm also sticking with the exercises despite the comfort  love sarah
Posts.Title: mammogram before op

Posts.Content: Defo just doubly checking, after all, all this prep is to guide the surgeon to the right place to ensure minimal scaring.   I was a pin cusion on the morning of my surgery but can look bac n laugh now with a slight cringe ha.  Had to b there for 9.30 to have nuclear medicine so they could (with a marker pen) mark were my nodes were with a little note written on my shoulder for the surgeon wasnt given enough anisthetic so of course I screamed ha, Then went over the road to a different hospital for an ultra sound were she marked on 1 of my boobs were the remaining tumour was along with another note for the surgeon ha, unfortunately the US couldn't find the tumour in my other boob so had to walk accross corridor wrapped in a gown for a mammagram n have wire put in,  again wasn't given enough anisthetic so of course I screamed. Then seconds l8r anither mammagram to check the wire was in the correct place by now I wanted to punch the nxt nurse who dare come near me with another needle. By lunchtime my boobs n ribs were covered in notes n arrows all to guide the surgeon. good luck it will all b over b4 u know it.  Wishing u a speedy recovery  love Sarah x
Posts.Title: mammogram before op

Posts.Content: It all came good in the end, my surgeon came to see me just b4 my op (fantastic lady) to have a look at all the prep work.  It was quite a comical moment, I took my top half off stood there and said 'you won't loose this bit of paper will you.  We bot couldn't stop laughing at all the notes written on me. ive seen the word cording few times now, which I'm not familiar with, Judith/anyone can u explain what this is please, I'm also sticking with the exercises despite the comfort  love sarah
Posts.Title: mammogram before op

Posts.Content: Good morn all not been on ere for long time.  It's been nearly a year now since my diagnoses and Ive gone thru the whole cycle of chemo-op-rads and now getting used to taking Tamoxofen for nxt 10 years.   Im feeling much stronger as the days go by emotionally and physically, and wanted to share some news with you Not sure if any newbies on here have attended a 'Look Good Feel Better ' yet,  well I highly recommend it.  After my chemo finished I decided to go along to a session, I had a fantastic afternoon with a bunch of ladies all at different stages of treatment.  We all put makeup on together with guidance from volunteers (pro's) we had a few giggles and came away feel revitalised, also a goody bag of cosmetics which I add up and would have cost near £100 this really shocked me and felt overwhelmed that these lovely people give up their own time to help us feel good at such a crappy time. Now I'm stronge enough I want to start fundraising and my 1st fundraise is climbing Londons O2 roof I can't wait I'm so excited and all what is raised gets donate to L.G.F.B so they can continue these lovely sessions. So if you not yet been to 1 get I touch with your Macmillan in they will help you book a session.  Go on.. Do it.. You deserve it  love Sarah x
Posts.Title: Giving something back

Posts.Content: Ahh Susie love I remember my 1st chemo like it were yesterday.  You prob already know it is a tough time ahead and you will have times when you feel like your body is rotting away but on those tough days remind yourself it's a powerful chemical and it's doing its job.  Hang tough lady you CAN and you WILL get through this. Be kind to yourself and listen to your body and rest as much as u can. big hugs  Sarah x
Posts.Title: Giving something back

Posts.Content: Ahhh all clear for 4 yrs that's fab,  sounds like life has been very busy for you I love cats but unfortunately hubby is allergic n my off spring have inherited the allergy too. Your poor dad hope he continues to fight well  love Sarah
Posts.Title: Giving something back

Posts.Content: Hey sister snail,  nice to here your still in n out of here.  I am feeling so much better I had a counselling session but decided 1 was enough.  Then something just clicked and I said to myself I either carry on this emotional slippery slope into depression or I snap out of it and give myself a bloody good shake in start living again.  so been really enjoying the six wks holidays took hubby and children to Devon 4 a wk that was wonderful I even got up a 6am and went for a run along the water felt so free.  The climb is on the 5th sept and I will gladly put details on here for anyone else who wishes to donate, thank you  Hooe all good your end  love Sarah
Posts.Title: Giving something back

Posts.Content: Hi ladies, I was not told/ warned about this and have still been using my usual 'Sure' deodorant with no problems nor have I needed to shave hee hee, armpits are still soft as a babie bum and Ive got cycle number 5 nxt wk.  To add to this bonus I've not needed to shave my legs either double whammy yay x
Posts.Title: Chemo and deodorant

Posts.Content: Well hello ladies,  hope ya all sort of ok. Not posted for some time.  I will b started rads in few wks.  Op (lumpectomies both sides n 12 nodes taken) was 98% successfull tho some ugly cells having got into my blood vessels so 4 wks of rads should blitz them strays.  It's been 4wks since op n I'm still so sore on the sides my nodes were taken, lots of fluid still n by the end of each day my armpit looks so swollen also still not a lot of feeling in the skin which feels really strange.  Anyone know how long this all goes on for?  Also I've been told I will b taking tamoxifen for nxt 10 yrs again anyone on this drug who can share there experience with me?  My head is in abit if a spin.. Stepping into the unknown again  love Sarah
Posts.Title: Nxt hurdle

Posts.Content: Good morning ladies, thank u sooo much for ur replies,  I'm feeling so low n can't pick myself up which is really frustrating when I think what I've gone thru since September.  Chemo knocked the stuffing out of me but kept going. Now I'm feeling like I'm running out of energy n feel like curling up n crying but putting on a smile for my kids coz I don't want them to know I'm broken.  When I finished chemo I was so possitive about the future, gave up smoking 5wks ago to try and make my quality of life better.  I've been taking champix to help me with this n side effects r a bit like menopause n was looking forward to finishing this course n feel normal again.  Then I read the side effects of tamoxifen and at the age of 39 I'm finding it hard to accept I may never feel like my old self again. good luck to u both  love Sarah
Posts.Title: Nxt hurdle

Posts.Content: Hi Dendy good for you, how long have you been smoke free? And how did you do it? Sadly I do miss smoking so much when it's been part of my life for over 20yrs it's the routine I find difficult, the champix is helping with the withdrawal, I'm so glad to hear you are recovering so well and yes I'm determined to continue with the exercises, Think the past 6mths is just catching up with me now the roller coaster is slowing down and just rads to go but brakes me to think I may face menopause so early in life.
Posts.Title: Nxt hurdle

Posts.Content: Got app nxt wk to have my CT scan n line up where the rads will go then I assume not long after that.  I guess I'm just having a bad day will soon pick myself up.  Yayy 3yrs GnJ can't wait to be saying that well done, if these champix don't do the job I may try these Ecigs, couldn't get on with patches tried them few yrs ago  Sarah
Posts.Title: Nxt hurdle

Posts.Content: Good luck with ya op, I had mine nearly 4 wks ago now lumpectomy both sides n 12 nodes taken.  Recovering well but slow which is frustrating. (I've never been a patient person) Start 4 wks of rads soon to get any stray cells left which I've already been told there r a few that have got into my blood vessels,  which is why they use rads to clean up I guess. will b think of you Thursday  love Sarah x
Posts.Title: silly question time !!!

Posts.Content: Rads r also given if u have had chemo prior to lumpectomy because chemo not only shrinks the tumour it also shatters it which is why there is a chance of pocket cells hence the need 4 rads to clean up wot the surgeon can't get to.  Last hurdle girl we can do this x
Posts.Title: silly question time !!!

Posts.Content: I would try antihistamine n keep moisturised as soon will prob go the other way n dry up.  1 day into finale Tax num 3 n I've bloody over done it grr.  Went to asda this morn walked round like a zombie 4 an hr bought lots of what wasn't on list lol.  This afternoon baked a Valentine's heart shaped cake for hubby n venesse biscuits for my rug rats. Now have throbbing feet n water retention grr.  Think I will sleep 4 nxt few days lol
Posts.Title: The Royal Marsden Cancer Cookbook

Posts.Content: Yum that's sound nice enjoy the rugby x
Posts.Title: The Royal Marsden Cancer Cookbook

Posts.Content: Saw my surgeon 2day, she is really plz with how my body has reacted to chemo n I've gone from lumpectomy one side n mastectomy other side to both being lumpectomy yayyy, I'm over the moon n actually for the 1st time left the hospital with a gr8 big smile. Got MRI nxt wk to give a better pic n hopfully confirm wot she plans on doing. Just git to get last chemo done then full steam ahead for op, finally last lap of rads then it's PARTY TIME. Now having a much need glass or two of vino  Sarah x
Posts.Title: In a bubble

Posts.Content: Thank you peeps n thanx 4 warning Bev, yeah I'm not looking 4ward to the lymph removal but hey ho just want rid of it all xx
Posts.Title: In a bubble

Posts.Content: Oh bev I can't even stomach the thought of the nxt hurdle, I'm yet to have op n rads, got an app with surgeon nxt wk n will find out if I'm having mastectomy or not eek. yayyy for u Strawb that's amazing, sooo can't wait to say number 6, is your journey complete now or have u got rads? Sarah x
Posts.Title: Rotting away

Posts.Content: Ah thanx Anastasia, it's gr8 hearing words like that to give u that extra push. Hello Jeanette, sorry to hear ur journey is about to begin but welcome to the chemo club.  You have already some idea of what to expect, you may also b a very lucky 1 n not get half of what you have read.  FEC-T is the name of chemo, there are others depending on which type of breast cancer you have 'I think'  Sarah x
Posts.Title: Rotting away

Posts.Content: Ahh Katee that's so lifting knowing ur hair growing bac already so pleased for u,  I've lost bout 75/80% of mine n have been looking at old pics remembering good old days. silly really only makes me all emotional  thanx GnJ I have found pasta is nice around this part of the cycle n can't get enough chilli, bread n potatoe r well off the menu can't handle the texture, so really missing a good cuppa n slice of toast ha biscuits sound promising, will add em to my shopping list :)
Posts.Title: Rotting away

Posts.Content: Ive spent past few days in n out of sleep, my poor husband has been keeping his job, our children n this hse going, whilst I lay rotting away. chemo 5/6 Fec-T, almost there but beggar me these sideeffects are killing me aches, sore mouth, tummy tender grrr. So hard to b positive when ya body feels like this n to top it off food tastes nasty again n I'm starving lol hope u have had a better day  Sarah x
Posts.Title: Rotting away

Posts.Content: I've just had 5/6 FEC-T and after my 5th they gave me 7 injection to do myself.  My cells have also been fine by the time nxt treament was due.  It's extra precaution as you reach ya last 2 treatments ya cell never return to a normal level n by having these injection a wk b4 ya low immune wk should help u thru that dip.  I've had no side effects from them n to b honest they have your health in thier best interest hope this helps. Sarah x
Posts.Title: G scf ,help

Posts.Content: Kateandbiz good luck with ya last one and make sure you got some pain killers I started getting very sharp pain like stabbing needle near my scares I was told its normal so don't b alarmed if you get them.  My skin has also gone like a burnt colour brownish keep moisturising,  my scares are starting to go very dry and my last rad was the 11th so aftershock does drag on for a few wks. yayy  littlesusie I want to burn all my beanie hats ha ha.  Oh said a sad farewell to my other big toe nail 2day, it got caught and just pinged off grrr ha  stay strong jediknight but if ya feel low have a damn good cry you will feel better afterwards I done this so many times then picked myself up and carried on. George I love this Quote it is sooo true love n hugs Sarah xx
Posts.Title: Said my goodbyes

Posts.Content: Had my follow up app with radiologist yesterday and all is good recovering well after rads and was told no need to see oncologist till 6mths, wow I thought no more hospital how strange it feels it's like letting go of a baby and hope they walk ha ha. Now to find the courage to start my Tamoxifen (praying it's good to me) So that is that nearly 10mths ago my world crashed to a hault and thrown onto an uncontrollable rollor coaster, now I'm reflecting and can't believe I had chemo x6 FEC-T, lumpectomy on both boobs, 12 lympthnoids out and finally 20 blasts of radiotherapy. Now that's hard core treatment ladies we have all faced or is beginning to face. I guess what I'm trying to point out is, when you think you can't go on anymore somehow we just find that strength to soldier on and it saddens me to read newbies joining the grp and remembering the fear I had.  You will be fine it's tough I will not lie but you can kick ass just like I DID !! much love Sarah xx
Posts.Title: Said my goodbyes

Posts.Content: Yayy well done 'start to get better' I like the sound of that.  My pains are easing off now thank god so sharp I would b sat watching tv with hubby nxt min I'm holding my breath in pain making him jump ha ha. I'm glad you been for a treat. good luck with the Anastrozole how long have you got to take that for.  I'm going to start my Tamoxifen 2nite grr if there good to me will b on them for 10yrs but if that's the price I have to pay to stop it returning then so b it. all the best for the future  Love n hugs Sarah xx
Posts.Title: Said my goodbyes

Posts.Content: Ahhh I'm doing the 'moving forward' in sept as well but seems so far away so Macmillan have arranged some counselling. I done the 'look good feel better' and was really shocked with all the goodies. Hey Ali I hope the rest of your journey flies by roll on April well for you anyway not so much for me as I reach the big 40 in April ha ha  xx
Posts.Title: Said my goodbyes

Posts.Content: I had sore mouth and lips 4 just over a wk I used the mouthwash 4 times a day like they said and it burnt like crazy, my mouth couldn't tolerate bread or potatoe the texture was just wrong and couldn't drink tea or other hot drinks as my throat also was bad think it may have been oral thrush, got clinic 2moro so gonna ask some question about the mouth business, it will pass keep smiling  love Sarah x
Posts.Title: Aches & pains - part 2

Posts.Content: Fantastic, hope this last cycle not to uncomfortable but knowing its ya last im sure make this one bearable, I'm soo looking 4ward to the 12th when I can say 'screw u chemo but thanx for do ya job' hee hee.  Well done girl u kicked ass  Sarah x
Posts.Title: yahooo

Posts.Content: Wowww check you out stunning is an understatement, what gorgeous style you have really suits you I genuinely mean that.  Mine has gone all curly at the back and trying to grow up I have no control I really don't know what to do with it ha ha. Sarah xx
Posts.Title: Took the plunge and went to hairdressers today ...

Posts.Content: My nails have also been hurting during this cycle, they have gone slightly yellow but not a lot.  I love my nails with passion even more so now the rest of my body feels like it's deteriating.  So I do spend a lot of time taking care of them, massaging 'solar oil' in every few days and I keep them painted as advised by chemo nurse as this keeps them strong, the pain only last about a wk.
Posts.Title: Weird nails

Posts.Content: Ah Helen if only it was that, I've not been poorly since I was on chemo thanx for the suggestion tho x
Posts.Title: I'm back n worried

Posts.Content: Meeting my surgeon 2day to discuss MRI results n hopefully make finale plans n set date for surgery.  Very nurvious but need a date so I can mentally prepare myself fior the nxt step  App not till 3pm so gonna give my kitchen a make over n move a few things above to confuse the hell out of hubby n kids.  The cupboards do need organising better that's the excuse I will b using hee hee
Posts.Title: Results 2day

Posts.Content: Ha ha like I said they need more organisation so really if they use their loaf they should b able to work out were things are but then again my logic thinking doesn't necessarily correspond with theirs. I could b really mean n change the cutlery draw that would really cause mayhem but then again that would do my nut in as well ha ha.  He who seek shall find (no help from mumma bear)  Ah you've reminded me to ask bout my portacath eek more stitches
Posts.Title: Results 2day

Posts.Content: I can hold on to hope can't I,  things r moving very quick I saw doc last Wednesday the day I found IT n I got a letter yesterday from hospital with 2 app nxt Thursday 1 for an ultrasound n the other is straight after hopfully to discuss  results. Fingers crossed
Posts.Title: I'm back n worried

Posts.Content: Ahh so good to see you still popping in Ali  2014/15 was an awful year.  But this sight helped us through those dark days with a few giggles along the way.  Hope ya doing well love Sarah thanx for the hug
Posts.Title: I'm back n worried

Posts.Content: Hi George no it's no were near scars but same side as my nodes clearance. i feel so sick n convinced it's back, it's so hard to b positive when thoughts n feelings  r still raw from last year, back to the dreaded wait.  I saw doc yesterday (which feels like last mth) n she going to write to my onco who dealt with me last time.
Posts.Title: I'm back n worried

Posts.Content: Oh Ali owl I'm sooo sorry 4got to ask how was your 1st session hope you have been resting and hope it wasn't too daunting 4 you xx
Posts.Title: Food glorious food

Posts.Content: Morning Anastasia curry was lush gr8 end to cycle 4, starting to see the light at end of tunnel, gr8 feeling. how r you getting on which cycle have you got too?, so many on here I'm loosing track of how far peeps are getting. much love bac to you x
Posts.Title: Food glorious food

Posts.Content: After a year of batt breast cancer I had my all clear mamogramme in october.  Finally I can move forward book a holiday to turkey for hubby, myself n my 3 darling children, for this August then boom I find a lump in my colobone, so now waiting to see onco for test.  My world feels like it's crashed AGAIN
Posts.Title: I'm back n worried

Posts.Content: Never thought I would hear myself say this but I'm actually pretty excited about getting 2moro done then I can scream out ONE MORE JUST ONE MORE boom boom xx
Posts.Title: Food glorious food

Posts.Content: Ah poop to the infection, just to prep you 4 number 4, if you previously been feeling quite tried with the others number 4 is meant to b the worst fatigue out of all 6, they kindly told me after I had finished this cycle. On the plus not as much meds to take and nausea was only couple of days instead if a whole wk so onwards n upwards we kicking ass hee hee xx
Posts.Title: Food glorious food

Posts.Content: I used cold cap for all 6 sessions of fec-t,  the coldness is tough but after 20 min you get past the brain freeze and becomes bearable.  Had my fair cut into a pixi cut coz the weight of your hair hurts when your scalp goes through a sore stage as your hair does thin out abit. I'd say the Cold cap saved about 80% of my hair.  Defo worrh a try good luck  love Sarah
Posts.Title: isolated cells in nodes

Posts.Content: well it's the night b4 my 5/6 chemo, and have really enjoyed feeling pretty much normal 4 the last few days apart from extreme tiredness but can deal with that. So gonna treat myself to a lushus Indian takaway b4 food goes bac to tasting nasty, and dive into a massive bowl of ice cream 4  pudding hee hee got to b done
Posts.Title: Food glorious food

Posts.Content: Every time I went for my treatment there was always at least another lady with a cap on.  Depends how strong you r some women can accept loosing all there hair where as others like myself can't bare the thought of loose it.  I won't lie the cap is harsh so Coke you get ice forming round the edge of cap lol  and the tighter cap you got the more effective it is, so don't b afraid to ask for a smaller cap it really does need to be so tight.  you get proper brain freeze n feel abit woozy but it passes as your head gets used to it then I would start watching Eastenders on my iPad that's how doable it is.  The downside is it does make your sessions longer as this need to go on head 30min b4 treatments starts then bout 1-2 hrs after treatment has finished.   Sadly I may b facing chemo again After finishing my battle 7mths ago, i get CT results n hopefully treatment plan on Wednesday praying for no chemo again but it is what it is n I got through the it last time I can do it again. goor luck with your decision  Love Sarah
Posts.Title: isolated cells in nodes

Posts.Content: Defo tell them as we r all different and it's their job to play about with ya meds to suss out wot suits you best.  Defo don't put up with it either.  I found drinking tea or eating anything dairy made the situation worst around the sicky days, so eased off that whilst I was taking the anti sicky pills. good luck Sarah x
Posts.Title: That awful nausea!

Posts.Content: I've had 10 blasts so far and skin is just started to get hot and sore like sun burn, very tender nipples and my bra is starting to annoy me.  I've been using aloe Vera gel to sooth and I keep it in the fridge but to b honest don't think there is anything that will stop the soreness it's more a bout keeping ya baps moisturised so the skin doesn't crack and cause infection, 10 more to go for me, good luck with ya rads love sarah x
Posts.Title: What is the best cream to use before I start radiotherapy

Posts.Content: I've used it throughout my journey n lost bout 80% I've had 5/6 FEC-T,  it's thinned a lot n I got a little obsessed with buying hats hee hee, had my hair cut in a pixie style at beginning still have hair on top n a good fringe. It is tough not gonna lie but trust me if you can b strong enough to get passed 1st 20/30 min ya head goes so numb you can't feel the coldness after that.  Go 4 it if ya can't handle it at least you can say you tried. another warning try not to b too disheartened when you nxt wash ya hair some will fall out n it looks worst than it really is, I did cry all day tho, so started washing my hair every 3 days instead of every other day as normal I have switched to 'simple' as well they recommend it in chemo clinic.  The hair loss does slow right down tho n now when I wash it only a little comes away prob same as any other person. Hang tough n kick ass GIRL POWER xx
Posts.Title: Weekly Paclitaxel - hair loss

Posts.Content: I also had mine fitted just b4 my second cycle.  Christ at the time it felt like I'd been shot in th should ha.  I can remember a pinching feeling every time I moved my head think it was the stitches pulling because once they were taken out it was such a relief to b able to move freely. Approaching my 5th cycle now and port is fine and dandy good luck Wednesday x
Posts.Title: port painful?

Posts.Content: Well 5/6 FEC-T  done and dusted, still using cold cap which I would say has saved 80% of my hair goody goody, tho it's getting tough wearing it but last time on 12feb boooom. Very shocked with the size of my medicine bag I've brought home this time ha ha. 5 tubes of creams for dry skin, eye drops for dry eye, sickness pills, antibiotic mouthwash in case I get ulcers and oral thrush again ( common reaction to Tax) anti- reaction pills for tha Tax drug that it swimming around my system and finally the shocker of all, they now want me to bloody inject myself for a wk to help my white cells arghh come on really.  I've come this far with now extra antibiotic or major infections, my bloods have  always been fine just b4 treatment day.  They are really testing my strength now, asked my 16yr old (to lighten the mood and have a giggle about it) but she ran the other way saying no way mum I couldn't hurt you, asked my husband he screwed his face up ha ha so looks like I'm gonna have to grin n bare it. DVD n PJ day for me, feeling a bit wishy washy, darling kids all at sch, darling husband at work so me n much needed peace and quiet ahhh that's just what I need.
Posts.Title: Omg injecting myself arghhh !!!

Posts.Content: Good morning, Rebecca and Katee, I was offered a district nurse but didn't want to cause a seen, will give it a go n see how I get on.  Don't understand why I need em when this is my second Tax n wasn't given to me last time grr. lol Katee you made me laugh I've put on a whopping stone since Sept tho has gone up n down by half a stone throughout this grotty journey just hope I don't pile on any more so as 4 finding a flabby but shouldn't b a prob hee hee.
Posts.Title: Omg injecting myself arghhh !!!

Posts.Content: started the day pottering around sorting washing as I don't trust hubby with that job few other bits n bobs, flaked out by lunchtime, kept fluids up n watched DVD n now got bloody water retention in my feet n legs grr.  Glad I'm not they only 1 putting on weight must b all the drugs n steroids n not leading a normal active life, which I miss it so much, I'm always on the go find it really hard sitting still when things need to b done. Picking trying to find tasty food has been a nightmare everything taste rank for 1st wk it so, which is why I go mad in last wk when I can taste it LOVE ME FOOD hee hee. Littlesusie, u would make a good district nurse u could look after all us chickens I'm in Southampton by the way start injections 2moro, u in the area or passing thru anytime hee hee xx
Posts.Title: Omg injecting myself arghhh !!!

Posts.Content: Right that's decided I will do it 1st thing in morn b4 my hse turns into Piccadilly circus, as for weight loss now that's an added bonus the way I'm ballooning out feel like a blooming whale ha ha Littlesusie glad ya smiling hee hee x
Posts.Title: Omg injecting myself arghhh !!!

Posts.Content: Got app with surgeon tomorrow to obviously discus what they're going to do to me, just feeling more scared of the upcoming hurdle than I was b4 I started chemo which may I add my last 1 on the 12th yayyyyyyyyy  Sarah x
Posts.Title: Nervous

Posts.Content: I'm just not looking 4ward to stitches/staples n scared my 3yr old may knock me.  Don't get me wrong chemo has been hell but at least I've been able to play with my boy n have lots of cuddles.
Posts.Title: Nervous

Posts.Content: Thanks for your response Sister.  Not particularly worried just curious to see how common this was, I have numb fingers and tingles/pin n needles. Has your feeling returned?  Did you have nodes removed if so is your armpit still numb? Sarah x
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy side effects

Posts.Content: its been just over a wk since my last blast under the red beam.  Skin has settle a lot, doesn't feel so hot and tight like sunburn but now I'm getting really really painful shooting/stabbing pains, and e skin around scares has gone very dark and blotchy dark patches.  I'm also getting very restless arms in the evening driving me nuts. Can anyone relate to this? Another query tho but late now but,  I asked about the use deodorant during rads and was told it as ok but some on here have mentioned their radiologist have advised not to. Why is this?  Why are we all given different info? Sarah
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy side effects

Posts.Content: Way to go lady, I wouldn't like to piss u off hee hee :) Sarah x
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Round 2-Triple Negative

Posts.Content: Wow Nannymary fantastic reply I Soo love your attitude to life n BC your advice given makes sense n Google defo can put ya head in a spin. lovely to hear your recoverng well GIRL POWER Good luck Sally u kicked ass b4 lady u can most certainly do it again, on the plus it's a good job us ladies only have 2 boobies, chin up n get those KICK ASS BOOTS ON  Sarah x
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Round 2-Triple Negative

Posts.Content: Hi Debbie, I had different tumours in each breast I found the lumps and the tested em.  I had bilateral cancer grade3 ER HER2 negative in the right and grade3 ER PR positive in the left both found at the same time double whammy I called it.  I still don't really understand what all the abbreviation mean I just know the 1 was fed on hormone oestrogen so now I'm taking Tamoxifen 4 nxt 10 as this stops my body producing this hormone.  To b honest I got to tired with trying to understand it all now I accept that it's all gone and my year long living hell is over. I was told it was rare to have different tumours. Hope your near the end of your journey  love Sarah
Posts.Title: Different cancer in each breast

Posts.Content: Oh F--k F--k that's just crap I feel your anxiety, the waiting can do so much to the mind.  I suppose all u can do is keep busy get ya mind active on something else worth a try.  Sorry can't really help much but  thoughts r soo with u. good luck tomorrow Ali I'm 6 days into my 2nd dose of tax n my fingers n toe nails r starting to hurt again grr, starting to feel more awake now but energy does not last long at all now much love to ya both Sarah x

Posts.Title: Epic fail lol

Posts.Content: Good morning mysteryleo,   I'm also 38 with stage 3 in both boobs and lymph nodes, I was diagnosed in Sept last yr, I started my journey on FEC-T because the cancer was trying to spread so chemo although has nasty sideeffects has saved me so it's my best friend right now. I've just had dose 5/6 n I've used the cold cap all the way which has saved bout half my hair. FEC-T itself does give you what they call chemo head (fuzzy brain) for a few days so u may want to write things down so you don't get stressed bout tying to remember things.  Other effects I've had are sickness sore mouth and extreme tiredness but they give u meds to help you thru theses stages. Now I'm on my last 3 doses its switched to T, which I would rate the toughest cycles because there r different effects, my mouth gets sooo sore, tastebuds change and flu like symptoms (aches n pain in joints). Painful fingernails n toenails and blurred vision.  Don't 4 get you may sail thru this n not see any of these. Every time you go for your pre-chat you MUST tell them everything you have experienced don't matter how small get as much meds as you can to help you thru. good luck, you CAN and you WILL kick ass Sarah x
